short_description: This function performs 1D reverse wavelet transform.
long_description: This function is a driver function used for 1D DWT inverse transformation (reconstruction). It can perform transformation on multiple sequences simultaneously.  For each sequence, the related wavelet coefficients are stored in the meta table.  Finally, the function reconstructs values in time domain.

argument_clauses.name: Domain
argument_clauses.description: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queenâ€™s IP saddress or hostname.

argument_clauses.name: Database
argument_clauses.description: The name of the database where the input table is located.

argument_clauses.name: UserId
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.

argument_clauses.name: Password
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database password of the user.

argument_clauses.name: SSLSettings
argument_clauses.description: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.

argument_clauses.name: SSLTrustStorePassword
argument_clauses.description: The password for the SSL truststore.

argument_clauses.name: SortColumn
argument_clauses.description: The column in the input table that represents the order of coefficients in each sequence.

argument_clauses.name: InputTable
argument_clauses.description: The name of the input table or view contains the coefficients generated by DWT.

argument_clauses.name: OutputTable
argument_clauses.description: The name of the output table of the reconstruct result.

argument_clauses.name: MetaTable
argument_clauses.description: The name of the input table or view contains the meta information used in DWT, it should be a table or a view.

argument_clauses.name: InputColumns
argument_clauses.description: The columns in the input table to be transformed.

argument_clauses.name: PartitionColumns
argument_clauses.description: One or more columns identify different sequences, every row has the same value in partitioncolumns belong to the same sequence.
